Body:
I'm building an application that communicates with an embedded device (256mb RAM, 1Ghz CPU and Linux) over WiFi. I would like to know good frameworks that I could use to establish bidirectional communication. I have evaluated the following frameworks.

  • Socket.io Easy interface to communicate. The embedded device is running a Node.js server. Stable libraries for iOS and Android. Is using websockets to communicate in a local network an overkill ?.
  • MQTT
  • ZeroMQ Super fast, however mobile frameworks available seems to be outdated
What about setting up an XMPP server?
@Chris Not a bad idea, I will add that as an candidate
